intro: Canscora bidoupensis, commonly known as the Bidoupen rockbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features dense clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
